Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Remote Ischaemic Conditioning in Orthopaedic Surgery

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included RCTs investigating RIC in fracture healing and orthopaedic surgery.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the effects of RIC on outcomes following orthopaedic surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the effect of RIC on oxidative stress, measured immediately post-surgery.

Blinding.evidence: blinding was implemented in most clinical studies

Result_Outcome.evidence: Sixteen clinical RCTs with 628 patients undergoing elective orthopaedic procedures showed significant reductions in oxidative stress and pain scores, and improved oxygenation.

Harms.evidence: No severe adverse events were reported.
